author: timbeiko
content: Doesn't each EIP have an EthMag thread already? You think we should have a discord channel per included EIP as well?

author: lightclient
content: I feel like EthMag is that. But a lot of stuff happens outside of it and it doesn't always get ported back to Ethmag

author: radekkapka
content: I don't want to speak for everyone, but I think that most ad-hoc discussions happen on Discord/Telegram, so why don't we pick one and stick to it?

author: radekkapka
content: It would make ~~everyone's lives~~ my life much easier

author: radekkapka
content: porting anything sounds very naive IMO because who will do the write-ups of main points of each discussion?

author: radekkapka
content: I have a tendency to over-regulate things, so take this with a grain of salt, but it is annoying when someone says "This EIP has known issues A, B and C" and I have never heard of this because I have been probably paying attention to the wrong places

author: radekkapka
content: Or there were some private discussions that I was not a part of

author: radekkapka
content: The real-world example is EIP-7549, where pushing the EIP to the F-fork was discussed because of some issues, but I had no clue about them

author: radekkapka
content: I wouldn't even know where to look for them ðŸ˜…

author: radekkapka
content: I wonder if something like "Place X is the single source of truth for EIPs. Unless Y is explained there, there is no expectation that every team knows about Y" would help

author: radekkapka
content: Y could be anything: a known issue, a short description of an important insight, meeting notes etc

author: jameshe5018
content: <@504202741933932544> anything for you to share on 7549 and trickyness in it? ^
